greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} (1-x^(k^2)).
comment: The difference between the number of partitions of n into an even number of distinct squares and the number of partitions of n into an odd number of distinct squares. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 15 2018
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Martin Klazar, What is an answer? — remarks, results and problems on PIO formulas in combinatorial enumeration, part I, arXiv:1808.08449 [math.CO], 2018.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k>=0} (-1)^k * A341040(n,k). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 03 2021
mathematica: nmax = 200; nn = Floor[Sqrt[nmax]]+1; poly = ConstantArray[0, nn^2 + 1]; poly[[1]] = 1; poly[[2]] = -1; poly[[3]] = 0; Do[Do[poly[[j + 1]] -= poly[[j - k^2 + 1]], {j, nn^2, k^2, -1}];, {k, 2, nn}]; Take[poly, nmax+1]
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Dec 12 2016
